abstract: Intel is happy to stay in the background, letting folks like Novell and Canonical do with Moblin what they will. It’s a stance that ruffles Microsoft’s feathers a bit less.
snippet: Intel is happy to stay in the background, letting folks like Novell and Canonical do with Moblin what they will. It’s a stance that ruffles Microsoft’s feathers a bit less.
lead_paragraph: Software makers large and small have spent years toiling away at the Linux desktop. So, it’s a bit odd to find Intel, a chip manufacturer, doing some of the more innovative work to make Linux appealing to the masses.

headline.main: Intel’s Odd Role as a Lead Linux Promoter
